Journal.Title: Journal of geophysical research. Atmospheres : JGR

Article.ArticleTitle: Tropospheric NO<sub>2</sub> and O<sub>3</sub> Response to COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions at the National and Urban Scales in Germany.

AbstractText: This study estimates the influence of anthropogenic emission reductions on nitrogen dioxide ( <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>2</mn></msub> </math> ) and ozone ( <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>O</mi> <mn>3</mn></msub> </math> ) concentration changes in Germany during the COVID-19 pandemic period using in-situ surface and Sentinel-5 Precursor TROPOspheric Monitoring Instrument (TROPOMI) satellite column measurements and GEOS-Chem model simulations. We show that reductions in anthropogenic emissions in eight German metropolitan areas reduced mean in-situ (& column) <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>2</mn></msub> </math> concentrations by 23 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>%</mo></math> (& 16 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>%</mo></math> ) between March 21 and June 30, 2020 after accounting for meteorology, whereas the corresponding mean in-situ <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>O</mi> <mn>3</mn></msub> </math> concentration increased by 4 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>%</mo></math> between March 21 and May 31, 2020, and decreased by 3 <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>%</mo></math> in June 2020, compared to 2019. In the winter and spring, the degree of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mi>X</mi></msub> </math> saturation of ozone production is stronger than in the summer. This implies that future reductions in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mi>X</mi></msub> </math> emissions in these metropolitan areas are likely to increase ozone pollution during winter and spring if appropriate mitigation measures are not implemented. TROPOMI <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mn>2</mn></msub> </math> concentrations decreased nationwide during the stricter lockdown period after accounting for meteorology with the exception of North-West Germany which can be attributed to enhanced <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub><mrow><mi>N</mi> <mi>O</mi></mrow> <mi>X</mi></msub> </math> emissions from agricultural soils.
